definitions.definition: follow (someone or something) in order to catch or attack them.
synonyms: course; informaltail "I pursued him through the garden"

definitions.definition: seek to form a sexual relationship with (someone) in a persistent way.
examples: Sophie was being pursued by a number of men
synonyms: go after; Moreinformalmake up to; datedwoo
romance "he had been pursuing her for weeks"

definitions.definition: seek to attain or accomplish (a goal), especially over a long period.
examples: should people pursue their own happiness at the expense of others?
synonyms: aspire to "pursue the goal of political union"

examples: mercy lasts as long as sin pursues man

definitions.definition: (of a person or way) continue or proceed along (a path or route).
examples: the road pursued a straight course over the scrubland

definitions.definition: engage in (an activity or course of action).
examples: Andrew was determined to pursue a computer career
synonyms: carry on "she pursued a political career"

definitions.definition: continue to investigate, explore, or discuss (a topic, idea, or argument).
examples: we shall not pursue the matter any further
synonyms: probe "we will not pursue the matter"
